catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 892
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: inverted pear-shape; short neck; round mouth is wider than neck; light green glaze with darker green foliage and flower motif; lid is bell-shaped with darker grayish glaze and darker vine design
medium: Stoneware with iron-brown design under celadon glaze
text: Korean potters adopted various scrolling floral designs from imported Chinese ceramics, but the origins of such patterns can be traced to Central Asia, India, Persia, and as far away as Greece and Egypt. Goryeo celadons with scrolling patterns in iron oxide, such as this one, are prized for the exuberant, painterly quality of their brushwork.
title: Maebyeong with chrysanthemums
